metadata.title: CVE-2022-20567 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In pppol2tp_create of l2tp_ppp.c, there is a possible use after free due toa race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege withSystem execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-186777253References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-13-generic - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-4.15.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-4.15.0-13-lowlatency - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-13-generic - 4.15.0-13.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-13.14').
